Modified Asphalt Mixtures - Subtheme 2: Modified Asphalt - The study proposes a strategy for cost-effective and environmentally friendly modification of fiber surfaces . The lignin in bf, which affects the tensile strength of fibers, is dissolved by a deep eutectic solvent (des) system, and then the Lignin is reborn on the surface of the fibers with the assistance of tannic acid. Based on the hydrophobicity and free radical trapping properties, regenerated lign in lignins. The results show that bpf is expected to act as a natural coupling agent. The study shows that bf can greatly maintain or even improve the performance of the asphalt binder. The work introduces a simple and practical strategy for enhancing the interaction between bf and asphalt.

This paper proposed to recycle the waste mask fiber (mf) in combination with the waste cooking oil (wco) for hot mix asphalt (hma) application . The incorporation of mf can significantly improve the high-temperature rutting resistance performance of asphalt binder. However, it may also lower the asphalt's low-tem temperature. Modified Asphalt Mixtures - Subtheme 6: Pothole Repair Asphalt - Pothole Repair Asphalt: as one of the most common diseases of asphalt pavement, potholes can be defined as bowl-shaped cavities with steep edges of various sizes on the pavement surface . Currently, cold patching materials (cpms) have become a preferred choice for pothole repair on asphalt pavements in cold and wet weather, to timely restore pavement serviceability and improve traffic safety. The advanced cpms that can achieve longer repair longevity may be more cost-effective. The main objective of this paper is to review the state-of-the-art advanced cpm for more effective pothol repair of pothle repair of asphalt. The study is to Review the State-of the-artAdvanced cpms.
